bibl.title: Letter from John R. and Ida E. Kissinger to Howard A. Kelly, June 28, 1908

div1.p: The Kissingers are concerned that they have somehow offended Kelly.

div1.head: Letter from John R. and Ida E. Kissinger to Howard A. Kelly, June 28, 1908
div1.p:
The phamphlet you sent
was read with interest by Mr Kissinger
he thanks you for it and he now wants
me to ask you why you dont write any
more he is real bad again last
week had a very bad spell I am so
affraid he cant last long
for some time he has walked on
his knees but last week he become
so weak he cant be on his knees
his spine is so affected I cant
tell for my part what we are
2
going to do I try to work from
home but can not do it and
I have certainly about lost all
hope I have struggled along till
I cant hardly do it anymore
Dear Dr did we offend you in
any letters we sent you if we
did I am certainly very sorry and
am anxious to know what it was
if one has a good friend they
dont like them to drop away
without Knowing something for
Laura of it Mr Kissinger worries
and talks losts about you
and wanted I should write you
and ask you for any explination
of your not writing us anymore
we both always liked to
hear from you and always felt
you were our best friend.

Pleas let me hear from you
even your friends
